document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

889415EA06954048AFF2DACEEF00FD5E.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal
English.

B2349AC652D34211921D546EA8515BF7.description:
Make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive
elements) in presentations to enhance findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest.

630F0B7EF1EB4490858CA470331C221E.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically. The
content, organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

BDEDAF75171D4522A23ACB9FA51B0E49.description:
Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric, identifying
any false reasoning or distorted evidence.

A72BD3024DC14D12A53CE551A5A72150.description:
Integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse media or formats (e.g.,
visually, quantitatively, qualitatively, orally) evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source.

E7DBB0C8FAF94E11954E918E09EB3A3C.description:
Respond thoughtfully to various perspectives, summarize points of agreement and
disagreement, and justify own views. Make new connections in light of the evidence and
reasoning presented.

06349F765A3E436A89AD9C5A5380287F.description:
Propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that relate the current
discussion to broader themes or larger ideas; actively incorporate others into the
discussion; and clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions.

F47B298FB1604EDE98050A4259E19A66.description:
Collaborate with peers to set rules for discussions (e.g., informal consensus, taking votes
on key issues, presentation of alternate views); develop clear goals and assessment
criteria (e.g., student developed rubric) and assign individual roles as needed.

9A195A31F8324BB09DE290A47A25B2D3.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read and researched material under study;
explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence from texts and other
research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well-reasoned exchange of
ideas.

E285839283E743A5932BFC04122B3CED.description:
Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in
groups, and teacher-led) with peers on grades 9–10 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas
and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

C4A964E8B250463E8670568CC7F9D2D4.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and
shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

833E1969B868486E9DC023BC07EB0893.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using
advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question;
integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and
following a standard format for citation (MLA or APA Style Manuals).

89A286A98A55472DBE5A97A185F1F6B2.description:
Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including
a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate;
synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under
investigation.

3B1F51A05A644CEDAE7D360E997A0AF8.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, trying a
new approach; sustaining effort to complete complex writing tasks; seeking out feedback and reflecting
on personal writing progress; consulting a style manual (such as MLA or APA Style), focusing on
addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience.

AF3B0AAE029F4E9AA6BA98737E993D28.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or
resolved over the course of the narrative.

EDD547E7FCC746E78ED71326A999E6E9.description:
Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid
picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

E4540971E7FC4E938E2B60850C82C3E3.description:
Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to
create a coherent whole.

DA2F45E1D9494C9A9A32751BEF6725BE.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple
plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

380078D16F524F6FA90943F565A28ED6.description:
Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation,
establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or
characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

3463C0C96BAB4484AA84BBE99EE96DB3.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

1594ECB6BF544891AD7E22B3C4D59F17.description:
Provide a concluding paragraph or section that supports the information or explanation
presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

8962A6BE7B0F4E9484B50607A7C0070C.description:
Establish and maintain a style and tone appropriate to the audience and purpose (e.g.,
formal and objective for academic writing) while attending to the norms and
conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

748F0647107E4566AF469581B26090CC.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the
topic.

CB3A4E387C5540E6AF2AAAC2C4C5766D.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of the text, create
cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

DABF6653EEFF4CFB85A0C0E1457004D7.description:
Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions,
concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the
audience’s knowledge of the topic.

CE7797262A63461EA71BB82AD1267B6B.description:
Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make important
connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures,
tables), and multimedia when useful to aid in comprehension.

DC50173D1E024C37A8C88D185A66016B.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts (including the narration of historical events, scientific
procedures/ experiments, or technical processes) to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and
information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

96A53E0E3EED486B82A1567EAF7E1B23.description: Provide a concluding paragraph or section that supports the argument presented.

58318D46D2FE410BB40508CFF7FEC443.description:
Establish and maintain a style and tone appropriate to the audience and purpose (e.g.,
formal and objective for academic writing) while attending to the norms and
conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

64EA4D9346BE461095239E5423618AED.description:
Use transitions (e.g., words, phrases, clauses) to link the major sections of the text,
create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between
reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

CF1661978F8E450BAB241E382448ACEF.description:
Develop claim(s) and counterclaims using sound reasoning, supplying data and evidence
for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and
counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate manner that anticipates the audience’s
knowledge level and concerns.

7D4C195B6CC84BDE8D821FAFBE263A98.description:
Introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims,
and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among claim(s),
counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

095620C7991B4033AE19F5331E52C09E.description:
Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid
reasoning and relevant and sufficient textual and non-textual evidence.

BBD23254BF714F71A0D983EBC243EB6A.description:
Analyze and reflect on (e.g., practical knowledge, historical/cultural context, and
background knowledge) seminal and informational text of historical and scientific significance, including
how they relate in terms of themes and significant concepts.

047AC9E6443140EDA0121E2336740AA7.description:
Analyze and reflect on (e.g., practical knowledge, historical/cultural context, and
background knowledge) how an author draws on, develops, or transforms source material historical and
literary significance (e.g., how a modern author treats a theme or topic from mythology or a religious
text) and how they relate in terms of themes and significant concepts.

2F0D70DB6ED6466FB99BD75EB0E461CE.description:
Describe and evaluate the argument and specific claims in an informational text, assessing
whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and
reasoning.

D02F92A90FE145A1A6150D4CA58AE528.description:
Analyze, integrate, and evaluate multiple interpretations (e.g., charts, graphs, diagrams,
videos) of a single text or text/s presented in different formats (visually, quantitatively) as well as in
words in order to address a question or solve a problem.

971E4693053742C183D86684B6E84C0B.description:
Analyze integrate, and evaluate multiple interpretations (e.g., recorded or live production
of a play or recorded novel or poetry) of a single text or text/s presented in different formats (visually,
quantitatively).

277746A0E0AA4445BBA6305D34B29C73.description:
Determine an author’s purpose in a text (including cultural experience and knowledge
reflected in text originating outside the United States) and analyze how an author uses rhetorical devices
to advance that purpose.

A694ABB8573F49E7B0261A32F4EB2A78.description:
Determine an author’s lens in a text (including cultural experience reflected in a work of
literature from outside the United States, drawing on a wide reading of world literature) and analyze
how an author uses rhetorical devices to advance a point of view.

631D7754D73B450FBE91EB89531CA85D.description:
Analyze in detail the author’s choices concerning the structure of ideas or claims of a text,
and how they are developed and refined by particular sentences, paragraphs, or larger portions of a text
(e.g., a section or chapter).

EBC30EA0B5C045AFB0668D3D61179AF0.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning the structure of a text, order of the events
within it (e.g., parallel plots), and manipulation of time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create specific effects
(e.g., mystery, tension, or surprise).

B506B0C3D4E944F3BE21B9FCA047FC61.description:
Analyze how an author unfolds ideas throughout the text, including the order in which the
points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that are drawn between
them.

D29AA8850CF94A5FB633DAE704D52125.description:
Analyze how an author unfolds and develops ideas throughout a text, including how
complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop, interact with other
characters, and advance the plot or develop the theme.

47647CEC3F2F4FAB893D4DFA65204116.description:
Determine one or more central ideas of an informational text and analyze how it is
developed and refined over the course of a text, including how it emerges and is shaped by specific
details; provide an objective summary of the text.

37EA1C186D7D4092A143D092F0390308.description:
Determine one or more themes of a literary text and analyze how it is developed and
refined over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped by specific details; provide an
objective summary of the text

BD985D1314A54F909C29B154BC6E5DFB.description:
cite a range and thorough textual evidence and make clear and relevant connections, to
strongly support an analysis of multiple aspects of what an informational text says explicitly and
inferentially, as well as interpretations of the text.

307276F8E5C14344A9460368739BE1DC.description:
Cite a range of thorough textual evidence and make relevant connections to strongly
support analysis of multiple aspects of what a literary text says explicitly and inferentially, as well as
including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

AFFEC0E0BF784AFCB8F8271D8FCCEB53.description: Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

068A763E9BE5412DB6D329D66F385E69.description:
Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their
role in the text.

7B06A23C9EA6424181CB15B18EDA2CF1.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word
meanings, including connotative meanings.

F789A13D8EC940D0B810330F741CC308.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by
checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

0F24D7C4C5094EF292EDC02D9EE23457.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or
clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, or its etymology.

4A5DAA8EC9CC49FAAA53FB2083DABA52.description:
Analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how
the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper).

E10CE0CE7C2A40099E12DA7722D283CF.description:
Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or
parts of speech (e.g., analyze, analysis, analytical; advocate, advocacy).

242808F4F45A4009B0B85A8F5F7AD07E.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s
position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

1E585E0D46AD4DACA82ABBF0DF1B6B9F.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases
based on grades 9–10 reading and content, including technical meanings, choosing flexibly from a range
of strategies.

FAD465C2DF244576A11EF91170A56D08.description:
Demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a
word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

D051AA561DDF4F058B083E68D004C11F.description:
Vary word choice and sentence structure to demonstrate an understanding of the
influence of language.

6FF0E5A49C9A4501A7079FA880E61D0F.description:
Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases,
sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness
level.

57F3E4B708BD40F3AF5F97851317826F.description:
Apply knowledge of language to make effective choices for meaning, or style, and to
comprehend more fully when reading, writing, speaking or listening.

870B2EA5D746414EA32D2413A93A542F.description: Use a colon to introduce a list or quotation.

C8CA1661212E4FB88991903DAC019C79.description:
Use a semicolon (and perhaps a conjunctive adverb) to link two or more closely related
independent clauses.

7F71E1FF1C7B4E95BA3DC712770A66DB.description:
Use various types of phrases (noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional,
absolute) and clauses (independent, dependent; noun, relative, adverbial) to convey
specific meanings and add variety and interest to writing or presentations.

31B34662639D4298B79CE894FC3215F0.description:
Demonstrate command of the system and structure of the English language when writing or
speaking.
